arlin.dataset.xrl_dataset

Module Contents

Classes

XRLDataset

Class to store experiences from running a policy in an environment.
class arlin.dataset.xrl_dataset.XRLDataset(environment, collector=RandomDataCollector, seed=12345)

Class to store experiences from running a policy in an environment.

Initialize an XRLDataset.

Parameters:

  • environment (gym.Env) – Environment to run the policy in.

  • collector (BaseDataCollector, optional) – Collector we want to use to collect our data. Defaults to RandomDataCollector.

  • seed (int, optional) – Sed for episode creation. Defaults to 12345.

fill(num_datapoints=50000, randomness=0.0)

Add transitions to this dataset.

Parameters:

  • num_datapoints (int, optional) – Number of datapoints to add. Defaults to 50000.

  • randomness (float, optional) – How much randomness do we want when taking actions. Defaults to 0.0.

Return type:

None

get_dict()

Get a dictionary representation of this dataset.

Returns:

Dictionary representation of this dataset.

Return type:

Dict[str, List[np.ndarray]]

save(file_path)

Save dictionary of datapoints to the given file_path.

Parameters:

  • str (- file_path) – Filepath to save XRL dataset to.

  • file_path (str) –

Return type:

None

load(load_path)

Load a XRLDataset from the given path.

Parameters:

load_path (str) – Path to saved XRLDataset.

Raises:

  • ValueError – Missing a required dataset key.

  • ValueError – There is no data to load.

  • ValueError – Input keys do not have the same number of datapoints.

Return type:

None
